text.*:
Vladimir Nazor Award
Nagrada Vladimir Nazor
Awarded for Excellence in arts
Country Croatia
Presented by Croatian Ministry of Culture
First awarded 1959
Website http://www.min-kulture.hr/default.aspx?id=407 

The Vladimir Nazor Award (Croatian: Nagrada Vladimir Nazor) is an annual award given by the Croatian Ministry of Culture to Croatian artists for highest achievements in various artistic fields. It was established in 1959 and is named for poet Vladimir Nazor. As of 2016[update], the award is given in the following six categories:

  • Architecture and urbanism
  • Film
  • Literature
  • Music
  • Theatre
  • Visual arts and applied arts

Two awards are given in each category every year - a life achievement award (for overall contributions to their respective field) and an annual award (for notable works in the field in the past twelve months). The winners for the preceding year are announced every year on 19 June, the anniversary of Nazor's death.

Contents

  • 1 List of Life Achievement Award winners
    • 1.1 Architecture and urbanism
    • 1.2 Film
    • 1.3 Literature
    • 1.4 Music
    • 1.5 Theatre
    • 1.6 Visual and applied arts
  • 2 Notes
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

List of Life Achievement Award winners[edit]

Awards marked with † denote shared wins.

Source: "Dobitnici Nazora do 2004" (Microsoft Word Document). min-kulture.hr (in Croatian). Croatian Ministry of Culture. Retrieved 10 July 2017.

Notes[edit]

A. ^ Although classical music composer Ivo Malec was originally announced as the winner of the 2012 Life Achievement in Music Award, he turned down the honour. Following Malec's refusal, the ministry decided not to choose another recipient.[1]
